To calculate the customer acquisition budget required to achieve these sales, we will multiply the number of sales by the cost to acquire a customer at both the low ($2.50) and high ($20.00) ends of the range. Here’s a breakdown for each percentage of the addressable market:
**0.25% of the addressable market:**
Low estimate (885 sales):
$2.50/customer x 885 = $2,212.50
$20.00/customer x 885 = $17,700
High estimate (1,111 sales):
$2.50/customer x 1,111 = $2,777.50
$20.00/customer x 1,111 = $22,220
**1% of the addressable market:**
Low estimate (3,540 sales):
$2.50/customer x 3,540 = $8,850
$20.00/customer x 3,540 = $70,800
High estimate (4,442 sales):
$2.50/customer x 4,442 = $11,105
$20.00/customer x 4,442 = $88,840
**2% of the addressable market:**
Low estimate (7,080 sales):
$2.50/customer x 7,080 = $17,700
$20.00/customer x 7,080 = $141,600
High estimate (8,883 sales):
$2.50/customer x 8,883 = $22,207.50
$20.00/customer x 8,883 = $177,660
**3% of the addressable market:**
Low estimate (10,620 sales):
$2.50/customer x 10,620 = $26,550
$20.00/customer x 10,620 = $212,400
High estimate (13,324 sales):
$2.50/customer x 13,324 = $33,310
$20.00/customer x 13,324 = $266,480
**4% of the addressable market:**
Low estimate (14,160 sales):
$2.50/customer x 14,160 = $35,400
$20.00/customer x 14,160 = $283,200
High estimate (17,765 sales):
$2.50/customer x 17,765 = $44,412.50
$20.00/customer x 17,765 = $355,300
**5% of the addressable market:**
Low estimate (17,700 sales):
$2.50/customer x 17,700 = $44,250
$20.00/customer x 17,700 = $354,000
High estimate (22,207 sales):
$2.50/customer x 22,207 = $55,517.50
$20.00/customer x 22,207 = $444,140
These calculations provide an overview of the customer acquisition budget required to achieve various percentages of the addressable market, ranging from 0.25% to 5%, based on the given cost to acquire a customer.
